component-parameters.helperText: Public shelter BTG (betondaekninggrave)  is the most common type of civil defense struture in Aarhus.  Shelter Types refer to the plan of the shelter below ground, of which Aarhus has three main types: III, VI and VI (single, A and B subtypes). Indicate which is the likely type if you can make it out during the visit. Use the certainty slider in case of uncertainty!  If you select other, it means either the shelter is not a BTG but a SR (Sikringsrum) or CPS (combined public shelter) or something else entirely.
component-parameters.name: shelter-type
component-parameters.label: Shelter type

component-parameters.name: feature-id
component-parameters.helperText: Human Readable ID
component-parameters.label: Feature ID

component-parameters.name: hridShelter
component-parameters.helperText: Human Readable ID
component-parameters.label: hridShelter

component-parameters.helperText: This attribute is relevant only to shelters. Shelter subtype letters refer to how many times the shelter type/design iterates in one location. Each individual iteration needs own record. That way, an individual shelter of type I will have one record and subtype "Single iteration", while a cluster of two type I shelters will results in two shelter records of type I and subtype A. Consult your supervisor if in doubt.
component-parameters.name: belongs-to-shelter-subtype
component-parameters.label: Shelter subtype

component-parameters.name: overview-photo
component-parameters.helperText: Take a photo of the entire extent of the feature with a scale within.
component-parameters.label: Overview photo

component-parameters.name: take-point-from-gps
component-parameters.helperText: Take a point while standing next to shelter entrance as if you were going to enter. This is necessary as we will be modelling evacuation and need to know where the entry is to model accessibility. (If entrance is inaccessible because of tree or similar, make a note of where you captured GPS in the annotation)
component-parameters.label: Entrance coordinates

component-parameters.helperText:
Describe the environs of the shelter or feature, and specify its address so that others can find it easily after you.
List here also the number used for this location in the digitized archive records ("Bdnr") or in BBR register or other source data (. You should see it associated with a given address or note it in the map. If there is no number, please mark the date and name of the legacy map sheet, and describe in.
component-parameters.name: locale-description
component-parameters.label: Locale description

component-parameters.helperText: Describe what covers the surface of the shelter. Is it overgrown with grass, covered with shrubs, or converted into a playground or asphalted area?
component-parameters.name: landuse-on-top
component-parameters.label: Landuse on top

component-parameters.helperText: Describe briefly the setting of the shelter. What is the landuse within 50m radius of the shelter? Is it in a grassy area between residential blocks or is it under the street of the old town? If multiple different kinds of landuse co-occur, choose the majority and then add the rest in annotation
component-parameters.name: landuse-around
component-parameters.label: Landuse around

component-parameters.helperText: Indicate the shape of emergency exit as it is diagnostic of the construction date: square exit is common in WWII shelters, while round exist turret is typical of Cold-war shelters IV, V and VI. If not detectable, select NA.
component-parameters.name: emergency-exit-shape
component-parameters.label: Emergency exit shape

component-parameters.helperText: The specific location of an emergency exit will vary with shelter type. Check Tommy's instruction cards. A round shelter will have this exit on the top center, while a square shelter will have it off center, to the side or a corner. Please indicate its location relative to shelter plan and use Annotation or pictures for more detail. Make suggestions for a better typology!
component-parameters.name: emergency-exit-location
component-parameters.label: Emergency exit location

component-parameters.helperText: Helper Text
component-parameters.name: notes-on-emergency-exit
component-parameters.label: Notes on emergency exit

component-parameters.name: emergency-exit-photo
component-parameters.helperText: Take an extra photo of the emergency exit if it is obscured in the Overview photo
component-parameters.label: Emergency exit photo

component-parameters.helperText: Select from the list or define the type using Other + Annotation
component-parameters.name: entryway-type
component-parameters.label: Entryway type

component-parameters.helperText: Choose a field from the dropdown

options.value: Barred (concrete slabs or earthen cover bar access fully or partially)
options.label: Barred (concrete slabs or earthen cover bar access fully or partially)

options.value: Sealed (as in a layer of concrete seals a doorway)
options.label: Sealed (as in a layer of concrete seals a doorway)

component-parameters.name: accessiblity-of-shelter-during-visit
component-parameters.label: Accessiblity of shelter during visit

component-parameters.name: entryway-photo
component-parameters.helperText: Take a photo
component-parameters.label: Entryway photo

component-parameters.helperText: Helper Text
component-parameters.name: comments-on-entryway
component-parameters.label: Comments on entryway and access

component-parameters.helperText: Can you find a down-turned ventilation tube near the foot of the shelter? If so, measure its distance to the emergency exit in METERS
component-parameters.name: distance-from-swan-neck-to-emergency-exit-m
component-parameters.label: Distance from swan-neck to emergency exit (m)

component-parameters.helperText: Use a compass to measure which way the doorway is facing. Use this terminology: West-northwest (WNW) North-northwest (NNW) North-northeast (NNE) East-northeast (ENE) East-southeast (ESE) South-southeast (SSE) South-southwest (SSW) West-southwest (WSW)
component-parameters.name: entryway-direction
component-parameters.label: Entryway faces direction

component-parameters.helperText: If the shelter is accessible, look inside and provide a description of internal shape, contents, condition and status.
component-parameters.name: interior-description
component-parameters.label: Interior description

component-parameters.helperText: Provide any other suggestions of what might need recording
component-parameters.name: comments-and-recommendations
component-parameters.label: Comments and recommendations

component-parameters.helperText: Comment on feature location (if hard to find) , preservation and, if the feature is not a shelter, describe its characteristics, such as shape, external markers and dimensions here.
component-parameters.name: feature-note
component-parameters.label: Feature note

component-parameters.helperText: What led you to the shelter or feature? If the map, please indicate pin color in the Annotation
component-parameters.name: feature-source
component-parameters.label: Feature source

component-parameters.name: take-point
component-parameters.helperText: Click to save current location
component-parameters.label: Take point

component-parameters.helperText: Who is creating this record?
component-parameters.name: author
component-parameters.label: Author

metadata.name: Aarhus Shelters 2024
metadata.pre_description: This notebooks supports the documentation of the current condition, access, and location of Cold War and earlier civil defenses in Aarhus municipality
